history.text: hi!
what movie are we talking about today?
Hi, have you seen the movie The Blind Side?
I don't think so... the title sounds familiar though
I may have seen the preview
Who is in it?
It's a movie with Sandra Bullock about Michael Oher.
I like Sandra Bullock
I don't recognize Michael Oher's name
Quinton Aaron stars as Michael Oher, Tim McGraw is also in it
What's the premise of hte movie
I didn't know that Tim McGraw was acting.... what year did it come out?
have you seen it?
Oher had an impoverished upbringing. He was adopted by Sean (Tim McGraw) and Leigh Anne (Sandra Bullock) Tuohy.
The movie came out in 2009
Yes I seen it, it is a really good movie.
oh yeah!  i think I did see the preview.  It looked good....
I don't know why I didn't see it????  Oh well, maybe I will locate it via Netflix or Amazon Prime
It really is good.
What else happened in it?
It received moderately positive reviews
that decent
that's decent...***
Michael Oher was passed around a lot of foster homes but always ran away from them
anything really noteworthy?
oh.... that's not good, but if he ended up with a good family in the end... i guess it worked out.  how did he meet the family?
The friends of Leigh Anne thought she was crazy and didn't feel that the family was safe around Michael
well, i am glad that it worked out.  it sounds like he needed some stability.
anything else noteworthy?
Michael met the family when he met Sean, Jr. in a Christian School.
that is cool.....
Sean, Jr. is the son of Leigh Anne and Sean Tuohy.
I figured from the name Sean (the father)
Sorry, just giving information to help
No problem
The story goes on about the problems that Michael faces. How he can't understand why Leigh Anne took him in and is so supportive of him
That would be a soul searching quest on Michael's part.  I can understand the questioning.  Did he ever really feel accepted?

It really is a good movie and I am not doing it any justice. You really should watch it for yourself. And yes, he did finally feel accepted and actually chose to go to a college that his "family" went to.
Sounds like Leigh Anne is a strong woman.....  Sandra Bullock usually plays those roles though

uid1response.feedback: I like Sandra Bullock... and I like the roles that she plays usually.  I don't know how this one got past me.  Anyway, I think that User1 gave enough background info to intrigue me.  I will have to look into this movie.
